intro: Cyanus raimondoi, commonly known as the Raimondi's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that are typically arranged in a cluster, giving it a striking appearance. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
